name: logseq-db
title: Logseq DB
description: Search and quick capture to your Logseq DB graph directly from Raycast
author: kerim

commands.name: search-logseq
commands.title: Search Logseq
commands.description: Search pages in your Logseq DB graph

commands.name: quick-capture
commands.title: Quick Capture to Logseq
commands.description: Capture notes with tags and priority to Logseq

commands.name: capture-to-journal
commands.title: Quick Note
commands.description: Fastest way to capture a quick note to Logseq

preferences.name: serverUrl
preferences.title: Server URL
preferences.description: URL of the Logseq HTTP server

preferences.name: graphName
preferences.title: Default Graph Name
preferences.description: Default graph name - you can also select from the dropdown in the search interface

preferences.name: maxResults
preferences.title: Max Search Results
preferences.description: Maximum number of search results to display

preferences.name: apiToken
preferences.title: Logseq API Token
preferences.description: Token for Logseq HTTP API Server (required for Quick Capture). Find it in Logseq Settings > Features > HTTP APIs Server.

preferences.name: captureTemplate
preferences.title: Capture Template
preferences.description: Template for captured content. Use {content} as placeholder.

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
